instructions.name: accept_invite
docs: Accept an invite and register stealth address
The recipient provides their stealth meta-address

instructions.name: accept_invite_streaming
docs: Accept invite AND automatically add to streaming payroll
PRIVACY FLOW:
1. Employee generates a stealth keypair LOCALLY (not their main wallet)
2. Passes the stealth PUBLIC KEY as employee_stealth_pubkey
3. Employee account is created with wallet = stealth pubkey
4. Employee keeps stealth PRIVATE KEY locally
5. To claim salary, employee signs with stealth keypair
Result: On-chain shows "stealth ABC receives payment"
No one knows stealth ABC belongs to which real person

accounts.name: payer
docs: Payer for the transaction (can be main wallet or relayer)

accounts.name: employee_stealth_pubkey
docs: The stealth public key that will own the Employee account
This is generated locally by the employee, NOT their main wallet

accounts.name: batch
docs: The batch this invite belongs to (via invite.batch -> campaign)

accounts.name: employee
docs: The new employee account (created with stealth pubkey)

instructions.name: add_employee
docs: Add an employee to a batch with streaming salary

instructions.name: batch_claim_withdraw
docs: BATCH CLAIM WITHDRAWALS
PRIVACY FEATURE: Processes multiple pending withdrawals in a single transaction.
This breaks the visual pattern of "1 withdraw = 1 tx" that analysts use for correlation.
remaining_accounts: pairs of [recipient_account, pending_withdraw_pda] for each withdrawal
Max 5 withdrawals per batch to stay within compute limits.

instructions.name: claim_salary
docs: Employee claims accrued salary (streaming)

instructions.name: claim_withdraw
docs: Claim a pending withdrawal after the delay has passed
PRIVACY: The recipient (stealth address) signs to claim.
Observers cannot link this to the original deposit.

instructions.name: claim_withdraw_relayed
docs: Claim a pending withdrawal via RELAYER (gasless for recipient)
PRIVACY FEATURE: The recipient does NOT pay gas and does NOT appear as tx signer.
Instead, a relayer submits the transaction and pays fees.
The recipient proves ownership by signing a message off-chain (ed25519).
Flow:
1. Recipient signs message: "claim:{pending_pda}" with stealth keypair
2. Relayer creates ed25519 verify instruction + this instruction
3. Relayer submits tx and pays gas
4. Funds go to stealth address without it being fee payer
This breaks: stealth_address -> fee payer link

accounts.name: relayer
docs: Relayer pays gas (any wallet can be relayer)

accounts.name: recipient
docs: Ownership is proven via ed25519 signature in previous instruction

instructions.name: close_campaign
docs: Close a campaign (only owner)

instructions.name: create_batch
docs: Create a new payroll batch (index-based PDA)

instructions.name: create_batch_invite
docs: Create an invite for a recipient to join a payroll batch (using PayrollBatch)
Only the batch owner can create invites
salary_rate: lamports per second (0 = no streaming, just invite)

instructions.name: create_campaign
docs: Create a new campaign with a vault PDA
The vault is controlled by the program, not the owner

instructions.name: create_invite
docs: Create an invite for a recipient to join a payroll batch
Only the batch owner can create invites
salary_rate: lamports per second (0 = no streaming, just invite)

instructions.name: create_receipt
docs: Create an anonymous receipt when claiming salary
Called after claim_salary to create a verifiable proof of payment

instructions.name: donate
docs: Donate to a campaign
Funds go to the vault PDA, not the owner
The donor can use a stealth address as the source

instructions.name: fund_batch
docs: Fund a batch's vault

instructions.name: get_pool_stats
docs: Get pool stats (view function for frontend)

instructions.name: init_churn_vault
docs: Initialize a churn vault (call once per vault: 0, 1, 2)
PRIVACY FEATURE: Churn vaults enable internal micro-movements that
break graph heuristics used by blockchain analysts.

instructions.name: init_master_vault
docs: Initialize the global master vault (one-time setup)

instructions.name: init_privacy_pool
docs: Initialize the global privacy pool
Called once to create the pool PDA

instructions.name: pool_churn
docs: Pool Churn - Move funds from main pool to churn vault
PRIVACY: Creates internal transactions that look like real activity.
Breaks the pattern: deposit → (delay) → withdraw
Into: deposit → churn → unchurn → (delay) → withdraw

instructions.name: pool_deposit
docs: Deposit SOL into the privacy pool
PRIVACY: This instruction intentionally does NOT track:
- Who deposited (sender)
- Who will receive (receiver)
- Which campaign (if any)
- The individual deposit (only aggregate stats)
This breaks the link between donor and recipient.

instructions.name: pool_unchurn
docs: Pool Unchurn - Return funds from churn vault to main pool
PRIVACY: Second step of churn - returns funds, adding noise to the graph.

instructions.name: private_deposit
docs: Private deposit with commitment
PRIVACY FLOW:
1. User generates: secret (32 bytes random), nullifier_secret (32 bytes random)
2. User computes: commitment = hash(secret_hash || nullifier || amount_bytes)
where secret_hash = hash(secret), nullifier = hash(nullifier_secret)
3. User calls this instruction with commitment hash
4. On-chain: creates CommitmentPDA with commitment hash (not secrets)
Even an advanced indexer only sees:
- A deposit happened
- The commitment hash
- The amount (one of standardized amounts)
Cannot link to future withdrawal without knowing the secrets

accounts.name: commitment_pda
docs: Commitment PDA - stores the commitment hash
Derived from the commitment bytes so only one deposit per commitment

instructions.name: private_withdraw
docs: Private withdraw with nullifier
PRIVACY FLOW:
1. User provides: nullifier = hash(nullifier_secret)
2. User provides: secret_hash = hash(secret)
3. User provides: recipient address (stealth address)
4. On-chain verifies:
- Commitment PDA exists for hash(secret_hash || nullifier || amount_bytes)
- Nullifier not already used (NullifierPDA doesn't exist)
5. Creates NullifierPDA (marks as used), transfers to recipient
The nullifier breaks the link:
- Nullifier is derived from nullifier_secret known only to depositor
- Cannot be correlated to the original commitment without the secrets

accounts.name: payer
docs: Payer for the transaction (can be anyone)

accounts.name: commitment_pda
docs: Commitment PDA - verify it exists and hasn't been spent
The commitment is recomputed from secret_hash || nullifier || amount

accounts.name: nullifier_pda
docs: Nullifier PDA - created to mark this nullifier as used
If this account already exists, the withdrawal will fail (double-spend prevention)

instructions.name: private_withdraw_relayed
docs: Private withdraw via relayer (gasless)
Same as private_withdraw but with relayer paying gas.
Uses ed25519 signature verification to prove recipient ownership.

accounts.name: relayer
docs: Relayer pays gas

accounts.name: commitment_pda
docs: Commitment PDA

accounts.name: nullifier_pda
docs: Nullifier PDA - created to mark this nullifier as used

instructions.name: register_stealth_payment
docs: Register a stealth payment (metadata only, NO SOL transfer)
This helps the recipient scan for their payments
The actual SOL goes directly to the stealth address via SystemProgram

instructions.name: request_withdraw
docs: Request a withdrawal from the privacy pool
Creates a pending withdrawal with a VARIABLE time delay (30s - 5min).
The amount must be one of the standardized amounts.
PRIVACY: Only the stealth_address is recorded (not who requested).
The variable delay prevents timing correlation attacks.

accounts.name: payer
docs: Payer for account rent (the connected wallet)

accounts.name: recipient
docs: The recipient (stealth address keypair - signs to prove ownership)

instructions.name: revoke_invite
docs: Revoke an invite (only creator can revoke pending invites)

instructions.name: set_employee_status
docs: Pause/Resume employee streaming

instructions.name: set_stealth_meta_address
docs: Set stealth meta-address for a campaign
This allows donors to generate stealth addresses for private donations

instructions.name: update_salary_rate
docs: Update employee salary rate

instructions.name: verify_receipt
docs: Verify an anonymous receipt
Anyone can call this to verify that a receipt is valid
The verifier provides all data EXCEPT the amount
If the commitment matches, the receipt is valid

accounts.name: verifier
docs: Anyone can verify a receipt

accounts.name: receipt
docs: The receipt to verify

instructions.name: verify_receipt_blind
docs: Generate a blind receipt (for third-party verification without amount)
The employee provides a ZK-like proof without revealing amount

accounts.name: verifier
docs: Anyone can do blind verification

accounts.name: receipt
docs: The receipt to verify (blind)

instructions.name: withdraw
docs: Withdraw funds from campaign vault
Only the owner can withdraw

errors.name: EphemeralKeyTooLong
errors.msg: Ephemeral public key too long (max 64 chars)

errors.name: InvalidWithdrawAmount
errors.msg: Invalid withdrawal amount. Must be 0.1, 0.5, or 1 SOL

errors.name: WithdrawNotReady
errors.msg: Withdrawal not ready yet. Please wait for delay period

errors.name: BatchTooSmall
errors.msg: Batch too small - need at least 1 withdrawal (2 accounts)

errors.name: BatchInvalidPairs
errors.msg: Batch accounts must be pairs (recipient + pending)

errors.name: BatchTooLarge
errors.msg: Batch too large - max 5 withdrawals (10 accounts)

errors.name: InvalidChurnIndex
errors.msg: Invalid churn vault index (must be 0, 1, or 2)

errors.name: SignerMismatch
errors.msg: Signer does not match pending withdrawal recipient

errors.name: NullifierAlreadyUsed
errors.msg: Nullifier has already been used (double-spend attempt)

errors.name: InvalidCommitmentProof
errors.msg: Invalid commitment proof - preimage does not match stored commitment

errors.name: InviteNotPending
errors.msg: Invite is not in pending status

errors.name: InviteNoSalaryConfigured
errors.msg: Invite has no salary configured - use accept_invite instead

errors.name: InvalidReceiptProof
errors.msg: Invalid receipt proof - commitment does not match

errors.name: ReceiptEmployeeMismatch
errors.msg: Receipt employee does not match provided employee

errors.name: ReceiptBatchMismatch
errors.msg: Receipt batch does not match provided batch

errors.name: ReceiptTimestampMismatch
errors.msg: Receipt timestamp does not match provided timestamp

types.name: ChurnVaultState
docs: State for a churn vault (internal mixing vault)
PRIVACY: Enables micro-movements that break graph heuristics

types.name: CommitmentPDA
docs: Individual PDA for each commitment
Created when a private deposit is made
Stores: commitment hash, amount, timestamp, spent status

types.name: Employee
docs: Employee - Index-based PDA with streaming salary
Seeds: ["employee", batch, index]

types.name: Invite
docs: Invite account - stores invitation for a recipient to join a payroll batch

types.name: MasterVault
docs: Master Vault - Global singleton that tracks all indices
This hides organizational relationships by using sequential indices

types.name: NullifierPDA
docs: Individual PDA for each used nullifier
Created when a private withdrawal is made
Existence of this PDA proves the nullifier has been used

types.name: PaymentReceipt
docs: Anonymous Payment Receipt
Proves payment was received without revealing the amount
Privacy Model:
- commitment = hash(employee || batch || timestamp || amount || secret)
- The employee keeps the secret
- To prove payment: reveal (employee, batch, timestamp) + show receipt exists
- To prove specific amount: reveal secret (optional, for full audits)
Use cases:
- Bank: "Prove you have income" → Show receipt, proves employment
- Visa: "Prove you're employed" → Show receipt from recent date
- Audit: "Prove specific amount" → Reveal secret for full verification

types.name: PayrollBatch
docs: PayrollBatch - Index-based PDA (no pubkey or name in seeds)
Seeds: ["batch", master_vault, index]

types.name: PendingWithdraw
docs: A pending withdrawal request with time delay
PRIVACY: Only stores recipient (stealth address), not sender

types.name: PrivacyPool
docs: The global privacy pool that holds aggregated funds
PRIVACY: Only stores aggregate stats, no individual deposit tracking

types.name: StealthRegistry
docs: Registry entry for a stealth payment
Stores metadata so recipient can scan and identify their payments
